possess.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to have a particular quality or ability
possess.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: He no longer possessed the power to frighten her.
possess.translation[0].definitions[0].no: In everyday English, people usually say that someone has or has got something rather than possesses it:
possess.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Neither of them possessed a credit card.
Campbell was found guilty of possessing heroin.
possess.translation[0].definitions[2].de: if a feeling possesses you, you suddenly feel it very strongly and it affects your behaviour
possess.translation[0].note_box[0].items: Possess is not used in the progressive when it means ‘have’ or ‘own’ You say
He is possessing many good qualities
possess.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to own or have something, especially something valuable or important, or something illegal
possess.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: The US is the only country that possesses global economic, military and political power.
Judges rarely send people to jail for possessing illegal drugs, but they jail people for selling them.
possess.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to have a characteristic or ability
possess.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: He possesses the qualities required to manage the organization’s varied commercial interests.
